intro: Chrysocoma singularis, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in compact heads. The plant has a woody stem and produces a milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough, hairy texture. Chrysocoma singularis is often found in shrubland and rocky areas, adapting well to arid conditions.
